thread.title: Selfie-loving sorority sisters shamed at Rockies-Dbacks game
thread.title_full: Selfie-loving sorority sisters shamed at Rockies-Dbacks game

title: Selfie-loving sorority sisters shamed at Rockies-Dbacks game
text:
Selfie-loving sorority sisters shamed at Rockies-Dbacks game Watch as MLB commentators poke fun at a group of girls taking selfies at a game Post to Facebook Selfie-loving sorority sisters shamed at Rockies-Dbacks game Watch as MLB commentators poke fun at a group of girls taking selfies at a game  //on.kthv.com/1L8UJyF   Join the Conversation To   Selfie-loving sorority sisters shamed at Rockies-Dbacks game Melanie Towler, KARE 12:12 p.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Girls taking selfies at a Diamondback/Rockies game (Photo: MLB.com screen grab) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ARIZONA ( KARE ) -- "That's the best of the 300 pictures I've taken of myself today!" 
Two MLB commentators started poking fun at a group of fans during Wednesday's game between the Colorado Rockies and the Arizona Diamondbacks at Chase Field. Instead of watching baseball, the Alpha Chi sorority sisters of Arizona State were more focused on taking selfies. 
The group of girls took not just one, not two, but what seemed like an endless string of pictures of themselves. 
Announcers Steve Berthiaume and Bob Brenly turned their attention to the group at the bottom of the fourth inning. What started off as a request to "tweet your best fan photos" turned into a two-minute long rant about selfies. 
The Arizona State sorority girls were caught in the act as they posed with their hot dogs and churros. 
"Wait, one more now. Better angle. Oh, check it. Did that come out ok?" one announcer says. "Here's my first bite of the churro. Here's my second bite of the churro." 
The Diamondbacks beat the Rockies 3-1. It is unknown whether the girls even noticed. 
Watch the video for more! Your browser does not support iframes. Read or Share this story: http://on.kthv.com/1L8UJyF TOP VIDEOS
